image.altText: Pope Francis dressed in green adjusting his glasses

props.synopsis: The Vatican confirms the death of Pope Francis, who sat at the head of a church encompassing more than 1 billion worshippers worldwide. Follow live.

title.children: Pope dies just one day after greeting Vatican crowds on Easter Sunday

image.altText: A heart shape marked out by flowers in the sand.

props.synopsis: The number of coastal deaths over the Easter long weekend in NSW has risen after a nine-year-old boy died at South West Rocks on Sunday.

title.children: Boy dies off NSW beach as death toll rises

image.altText: A man smiles widely as he stands in front of a large wooden cross on a grassy hill with the sun rising in the background

props.synopsis: The faithful have gathered throughout Australia to mark one of the holiest days on the Christian calendar.

title.children: Australian Christians celebrate Easter Sunday across the nation

image.altText: Ted Mulry Gang

props.synopsis: Every week, Sunday night six o'clock, Australians settled down to watch a show so famous even King Charles III made an appearance.

title.children: One in five Australians used to watch this show. Now clips thought lost forever have been found

image.altText: A man holding a phone with data on the screen, two people are boxing in the background.

props.synopsis: Many online fitness programs can claim to build a butt or be perfect for building abs, but looking past marketing terminology to find a program that best suits your health and fitness goals can be challenging.

title.children: What to look for when choosing an online exercise program

image.altText: An outdoor festival entrance with lettering over the top that reads "National Folk Festival".

props.synopsis: Thousands of people turn out in Canberra for the 59th annual National Folk Festival, with acts ranging from Scottish fiddlers and poetry readings, to folk dancing and a music quiz show.

title.children: National Folk Festival 'steering true' after facing financial difficulties

image.altText: ACT court precinct

props.synopsis: It comes as the court heard there is a fifth alleged victim in the case. The doctor has pleaded not guilty.

title.children: Doctor accused of rape named after suppression order lifted

image.altText: A woman with red hair in a navy shirt staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: New CoreLogic data shows Canberra remains the second-most expensive place to rent a house at a median cost of $721 a week. It has created a widening housing divide in a city that boasts the highest weekly median income in the country.

title.children: Tiana's landlord and their parents live in her backyard. It's the only way she can afford rent

image.altText: John Evans and Bree Rizzo hold up the respective men's and women's Stawell Gift trophies.

props.synopsis: The hotly anticipated showdown between Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy at the Stawell Gift did not eventuate, while John Evans and Bree Rizzo won the respective men's and women's finals.

title.children: Gout and Kennedy miss out at Stawell Gift as Evans and Rizzo win finals

image.altText: Pete Hegseth addressing a meeting of allies.

props.synopsis: A month after sharing details of an attack on Houthi rebels in a signal chat group that included a magazine editor, US media outlets are reporting US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth also shared details about the mission with family members.

title.children: US defense secretary reportedly shared Yemen attack details with family

image.altText: Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri on the Jeddah podium

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri becomes the first Australian to lead Formula 1 drivers' championship in 15 years, passing Max Verstappen on the first corner en route to victory in Saudi Arabia.

title.children: 'He forced me off': Red Bull unhappy as penalty hands Piastri Saudi win

image.altText: Frank Carbone

props.synopsis: The vast majority of new arrivals in Australia end up in our capital cities. Experts and locals weigh in on how it's affecting our housing crisis.

title.children: The mayor of this Aussie suburb says it's 'full' as the migration debate heats up

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman signs a document while sitting on a park bench next to a man.

props.synopsis: A litigation funder will pocket one-sixth of a $180 million settlement in a historic Northern Territory stolen wages class action while the Aboriginal workers themselves will get "at least $10,000" each.

title.children: Judge critical of law firm behind $180m stolen wages class action

image.altText: An illuminated light box on a quiet street that reads BBQ Chickens take away

props.synopsis: From our coffee addiction to a weekend pub tradition, some of the simple pleasures many Australians have taken for granted now feel like luxuries. But if patrons can no longer afford to visit the pubs and cafés we love, there may be something bigger at stake.

title.children: 'The math isn't mathing': Middle-class consumption now feels closer to luxury

image.altText: A woman crying

props.synopsis: One commander has been dismissed as a result of an investigation into the killing of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency workers, who were found in a shallow grave a month ago.

title.children: Israel says killing of Palestinian medics the result of 'poor night visibility'

image.altText: Shaun Mannagh celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Geelong hangs on for a thrilling seven-point win against Hawthorn in front of an Easter Monday record crowd of at the MCG.

title.children: Cats hang on in dramatic fashion to beat Hawks in Easter Monday classic

image.altText: A man kicks the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Mitchell Moses has showcased his brilliance on return from injury with a dazzling performance in Parramatta's win over the Tigers on Easter Monday.

title.children: Moses masterclass delivers Parra win in Easter Monday classic

image.altText: Aerial shot of fenced land with bush on one side and a carpark on the other.

props.synopsis: A proposal to transform a "neglected" Swanbourne "dust bowl" into an oasis for terminally ill children draws the ire of some who want the site to remain in hands of the local council.

title.children: Dispute escalates over Perth children's hospice park plan on A-class reserve

image.altText: Man looking at camera smiling

props.synopsis: A 47-year-old man is denied bail after being charged with the murder of father of two Dylan Gray, who was fatally stabbed on Easter Sunday on the NSW south coast.

title.children: Father stabbed to death outside farmers' market was a 'good kid'

image.altText: A smiling young girl with fair hair.

props.synopsis: A Queensland high school student killed in a e-scooter crash on Easter Saturday is being remembered as a caring young girl whose smile would light up a room.

title.children: Big-hearted 12-year-old with 'cheeky grin' mourned after e-scooter crash

image.altText: He has curly grey hair, stubble and wears a green and blue striped jumper.

props.synopsis: The Anangu built one of the nation's most remote communities after nuclear bombs were tested on their country. But they face profound challenges amid extreme weather and rising costs.

title.children: Faced with extremes, the Spinifex People are being pushed to the limit

image.altText: Aliir Aliir of Port Adelaide catches a ball during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The Swans are trying to find out if the fan who through an object over the fence at Port Adelaide's Aliir Aliir during their AFL clash is a member.

title.children: AFL fan removed by police after throwing object at Aliir

image.altText: Two people standing at polling booths casting a vote.

props.synopsis: Political polling has been around as long as democracy itself and its influence on the election cycle is undeniable, but insiders say it’s never been more challenging to get right.

title.children: Inside the influential industry forecasting a Labor victory

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: The prime minister has accused Russia of wanting propaganda to be promoted by Australians, after Moscow's ambassador to Indonesia said Australia had "no cards" to play in the situation.

title.children: PM labels Russian push to build military ties with Indonesia 'propaganda'

image.altText: Peter Dutton with Grange Chung at the Royal Easter Show. Candidate for Reid

props.synopsis: The Coalition says if it is wins government it will trial a national child sex offender disclosure scheme that would allow members of the public to request information from police about whether someone who interacts with their children is a convicted offender.

title.children: Coalition promises trial of child sex offender register

image.altText: Sam Darcy looks miserable as he is framed by the coach's whiteboards during a Western Bulldogs AFL game.

props.synopsis: Scans reveal Sam Darcy's ACL is intact but he has suffered an impaction fracture in his knee, which will require surgery for the young Bulldogs star.

title.children: Bulldogs star cleared of torn ACL but still needs surgery on broken knee

image.altText: A shirtless man poses in a wrestling ring.

props.synopsis: Wrestling star and actor John Cena will headline a three-day WWE event in Perth in October that is being touted as a major tourism draw for Western Australia.

title.children: WA government refuses to reveal cost of John Cena's headline WWE show

image.altText: An older gentleman wearing a blue long-sleeved shirt, navy vest and cap grins surrounded by varying shades of green foliage.

props.synopsis: It started when farmer Fred Perry's kids came home from school about 30 years ago, telling him he needed to take better care of the environment. Now, his small slice of a farming island is home to amazing birdlife.

title.children: 'I was a basher and a burner': How a farmer switched his outlook

image.altText: a media scrum in front of a newly build house

props.synopsis: The policies of both parties designed to increase housing supply are fine — they're just nowhere near enough.

title.children: Tradie problem fuelling the housing crisis needs more than a quick fix

image.altText: A young man with blond hair in a suit stands next to an older man with glasses.

props.synopsis: A how-to-vote-card released by the Greens on Sunday instructs voters to pencil in a federal candidate who last week formally removed himself from the race, opening the party to criticism the move is a cash grab.

title.children: Greens urge supporters to vote for dropped candidate

image.altText: A dark blue logo with white text saying "cryptoloc".

props.synopsis: A politically-connected cybersecurity business has been liquidated months after winning a lucrative Queensland government contract.

title.children: Politically connected cybersecurity firm liquidated after winning contract

image.altText: More than a thousand dolphins can be killed in annual hunts in Solomon Islands

props.synopsis: A video showing the slaughter of hundreds of dolphins in Solomon Islands has gone viral on social media, sparking heated debate in Solomon Islands and the broader Pacific about the ancient practice.

title.children: 'Dolphin hunt' continues on this island, as debate rages over ancient practice

image.altText: Young smiling woman with long hair and brown blouse in front of painted wall mural.

props.synopsis: Six generations of Noongar and Yamatji women are celebrated on the walls of the Perth Institute of Contemporary Art as the institution showcases Indigenous art from all over WA.

title.children: Art gives voice to untold stories of six generations of women
